main event: A military observer at Camp Drum, New York spotted an unidentified flying object on September 6, 1956.
interesting points: The object was elliptical in shape and changed color from pink to white.
The object faded out gradually and then reappeared.
The object was observed for approximately 1 hour and 54 minutes.
The object was observed visually and through binoculars.
The witness, Sgt. Ronald R. Schalck of the Army, believed the object could have been a star, but the movement and disappearance did not match the characteristics of a star.
sighted object: an elliptical-shaped object that changed color from pink to white
